Authors:
Marta Potrykus, Malgorzata Golanowska, Wojciech Sledz,

Title:
Biodiversity of plant pathogenic Dickeya sp. isolated from
potato (Solanum tuberosum L.) and water in temperate climate
Keywords:
blackleg; Dickeya solani; monitoring; potato; PFGE; soft
rot; dnaX
Abstract:
Bacteria belonging to the genera Dickeya (formerly Erwinia
chrysanthemi) and Pectobacterium (formerly Erwinia carotovora) are
pathogens of many economically importsignificant crops responsible for
blackleg and soft rot disease on plants. In 2005, D. solani was isolated
for the first time in Poland from symptomatic potato plant. This fact
led us to conduct detailed study on the presence and biodiversity of
Dickeya sp. Strains isolated from potato plantations and the waterways.
We report 4-year survey giving insight into Dickeya sp. occurrence in
potato fields and waterways covering large temperate climate territory
of Central Europe. We performed dDetailed molecular characterization of
Dickeya sp. strains isolated from both plant and water samples in Poland
was performed and we compared them to the strains from other European
countries. Moreover, the maceration ability of Dickeya isolates was
determined on potato tubers. During the screening We have isolated
exclusively D. dianthicola and D. solani and D. dianthicola strains have
been isolated from symptomatic potatoes, while D. zeae and D.
chrysanthemi from waterways. Presented Our study shows, that Dickeya sp.
strains isolated from potato form rather homogenous group, while the
population of waterways Dickeya sp. represents higher level of
biodiversity. To our knowledge, this is the first report enclosing
comprehensive characterization of Dickeya sp. strains isolated in
temperate climate conditions in Central Europe.
